author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Gun owners may neeed $250K in liability insurance
text:
Mike Groll/AP Assemblyman Felix Ortiz, a Democrat, said his bill would hold “reckless gun owners accountable.” ALBANY — A state lawmaker from Brooklyn is pushing for a law that would require gun owners to have at least $250,000 in liability insurance.
Assemblyman Felix Ortiz, a Democrat, said his bill would hold “reckless gun owners accountable” and could prevent tragedies like the recent shooting of an 8-year-old girl in Tennessee by an 11-year-old boy.
The Tennessee boy used his father’s shotgun — which reportedly had been left in an unlocked closet — to shoot the girl after they’d gotten into an argument over puppies.
NINETY PERCENT OF NEW YORKERS — INCLUDING 80% OF GUN OWNERS — SUPPORT PART OF GOV. CUOMO'S TOUGH GUN CONTROL LAW, POLL SHOWS
WBIR Maykayla Dyer, 8, shot and killed by an 11-year-old boy in Tennessee. “Enough is enough,” said Ortiz (inset). “How can we protect our children from gun atrocities without a common-sense approach to provide victim compensation?”
New York State Rifle and Pistol Association President Tom King called Ortiz’s proposal “ridiculous” and argued it would be impossible for gun owners to obtain such insurance.
“Insurance companies don’t insure against criminal acts,” said King, a former insurance broker. “These guys are talking about things they don’t know anything about.”
Ortiz initially introduced his bill in 2013 but it has repeatedly stalled in committee and has not been introduced in the GOP-controlled state Senate.
